alert.note: Alert for Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Raft River Region (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 6:35PM MDT by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Oneida, south central Power and east central Cassia Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 634 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northeast of Juniper, or 23 miles east of Malta, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Juniper, Sweetzer Summit and Sublett Reservoir. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM MDT for southeastern Idaho.

area.areaDesc: Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Raft River Region
